description: a(1) = 2; then defined by property that a(n) = smallest number > a(n-1) such that successive runs have lengths 1,1,2,2,3,3,4,4.
links: William A. Tedeschi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 1 + floor( sqrt(4*n-3) ).a(n) = A049068(n) - n.a(n) = ceiling(2*sqrt(n)). [_Mircea Merca_, Feb 07 2012]
maple: A027434:=n->ceil(2*sqrt(n)); seq(A027434(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 01 2014
prog: (Haskell)a027434 = (+ 1) . a000196 . (subtract 3) . (* 4)a027434_list = 2 : concat (map (\x -> replicate (x `div` 2) x) [3..])-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2013, Nov 22 2011(PARI) a(n)=sqrtint(4*n-3)+1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 07 2012
author: Sam Speed (SPEEDS(AT)msci.memphis.edu)
extensions: More terms from Courtney Clipp (cclipp(AT)ashland.edu), Dec 08 2004
